intro: Gamochaeta paramora, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, purple to pinkish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Gamochaeta paramora is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local pollinators.
